page.title: 04LANHYDROCK HOUSE
page.content:
Lanhydrock House and Estate have been part of the {Local History}of Bodmin since 1651 when the house was completed by the second Lord Robartes. Since then the house has been almost totally rebuilt after a disastrous fire in 1881, when only the gatehouse and the north wing survived. The architecture is, therefore, mainly Victorian. The house and land remained in the hands of the Robartes family until 1953 when the house and 400 acres were given to the National Trust.
The National Trust was founded in 1895 to acquire for the nation ownership of land and buildings worthy of permanent preservation. Their wish was to give people access to areas of natural or historic interest. The Trust is part of {Tourism}in Great Britain.
